lines.text: [Repeated line in all 4 movies]
I'm too old for this shit!

Hey, look friend, let's just cut the shit. Now we both know why I was transferred. Everybody thinks I'm suicidal, in which case, I'm fucked and nobody wants to work with me; or they think I'm faking to draw a psycho pension, in which case, I'm fucked and nobody wants to work with me. Basically, I'm fucked.
Guess what?
What?
I don't want to work with you!
Hey, don't.
Ain't got no choice! Looks like we both been fucked!
Terrific.
God hates me. That's what it is.
Hate him back; it works for me.
[Picking up a young prostitute]
What have you got in mind?
Well, I want you to come home and watch television with me.
You serious?
Yeah. "The 3 Stooges" are on in 20 minutes.
Okay, clown, no bullshit! You wanna kill yourself?
Oh, for Chriss-...
Shut up! Yes or no - you wanna die?
Oh, I got the job done! What the hell do you want?
JUST ANSWER THE QUESTION!

Well, what do you wanna hear, man? Do you wanna hear that sometimes I think about eatin' a bullet? Huh? Well, I do! I even got a special bullet for the occasion with a hollow point, look! Make sure it blows the back of my goddamned head out and do the job right! Every single day I wake up and I think of a reason not to do it! Every single day! You know why I don't do it? This is gonna make you laugh! You know why I don't do it? The job! Doin' the job! Now that's the reason!
[after rescuing Roger and Rianne]
What did one shepherd say to the other shepherd? Let's get the flock out of here!
You know, Roger, you are way behind the times. The guys of the 80s aren't tough. They are sensitive people. Show a little emotion to a woman and shit like that. I think I'm an '80s man...
How do you figure?
Last night I cried in bed. So how is that?
Were you with a woman?
I was alone. Why do you think I cried?
Sounds like an '80s man to me...

[Riggs is tied up and struggling]
Why don't you save your strength? You're gonna need it.
Who's the chin?
Endo, meet Mr. Martin Riggs. Endo here has forgotten more about dispensing pain than you and I will ever know.
Terrific.
See, Martin, we have a problem. Since we have Murtaugh, we don't really need you. But I believe in being thorough.
Yeah, I've heard that about you.
Yeah. Well, our problem, and yours too, is we have a shipment of merchandise to deliver.
Why don't you guys just call it heroin?
It's rather large, this shipment. It would be unfortunate, however, if we showed up to deliver our HEROIN, and were surrounded by fifty cops.
That would be too bad.
Yes it would be. So, it's essential for us to find out all the cops know.
Hey, we don't know shit. You- you did Hunsaker before he could say...
No, no! I wish I could believe you. But unfortunately, I don't... Now if you would kindly tell me everything you know, I promise I'll kill you quick.
[snaps fingers]
I've told you everything I know.
Endo...
[gestures to Endo to 'start the pain']
Wha- what the hell is that?
I'll tell you what it is. It's called electric shock treatment.
Well, I guess we're in for a long night, 'cause I don't know shit.
We'll see. Endo...
[after stopping Riggs from shooting himself]
You're not trying to draw a psycho pension! You really are crazy!
You know they're going to kill her, don't you?
Yeah.
So if you want her back, you're going to have to take her away from them.
I know.
You do this my way. You shoot, you shoot to kill, get as many of them as you can. All you got to do is just not miss.
I won't miss.
We're going to get bloody on this one, Rog.
Are you really crazy? Or are you as good as you say you are?
You're just gonna have to trust me.
What do you do, sleep with that thing under your pillow?
I would if I slept.
The guy who shot me! The same albino jackrabbit son of a bitch who did Hunsacker.
You sure?
Yeah, I'm sure man. I never forget an asshole.
I do it real good, you know.
Do what?

When I was 19, I did a guy in Laos from a thousand yards out. It was a rifle shot in high wind. Maybe eight or even ten guys in the world could have made that shot. It's the only thing I was ever good at. Well, see ya tomorrow.
Yeah, see you.
[pauses]
Hey Riggs! You really like my wife's cooking?

[fixing him]
No. See you tomorrow.
I don't make things complicated. That's the way they get, all by themselves.
[Endo shocks Riggs with a device]
Hit him again!
[Endo does]
[Martin groans as his body shakes violently]

[soft but enthused]
Hit him again.
[Endo hits him again for longer]
C'mon, tell me about the shipment!

[yells and spouts giberrish, then spits at Endo, tries to reach Joshua]
I swear I'm gonna fucking kill the both of you.
Yeah, yeah, very funny. Now what about the *shipment*?

[Riggs is in a Christmas tree lot, and pretends to sample some coke for a buy]
Good, huh? Tasty? Smooth?
Yeah, that's good...

[walking up with a beer]
Here ya go, pal...
Thanks. Okay, so let's do it. How much?
How much for how much?
For all of it.
You want it all. He wants it all.
He wants it all, beautiful. Congratulations!
All right!
Maybe a nice six footer to put it under, huh?
You want a tree? I'll tell you what. I'll give you the best tree I got on the lot, for nothin'. But the shit's gonna cost ya... a hundred.
What, that much?
Hey, you said you liked it, that's a fair price.
Yeah... yeah! Hell, you only live once... get this together here...
[takes out his wallet, starts counting out a hundred dollars]
Twenty, forty, sixty, seventy...
Hey, what the fuck...
Hey, man... Hey!
C'mon, shut up man, I'm losin' count... Ninety-three, ninety-four, ninety...
Forget it, you dumbshit. One hundred THOUSAND. One hundred THOUSAND, DOLLARS!
A hundred thousand?
[laughs]
I'm sorry, I can't afford that, not on my salary. But I'll tell ya what, I got a better idea, here. Let me say I take the whole stash of your hands for free, and you assholes can go to jail.
[takes out his badge and puts it on the table in front of them]
What do you say about that? Now I could read you guys your rights, but ah, you guys already know what your rights are, don't you?

[drug dealers stare, then start to laugh]
This badge ain't real. YOU ain't real.
No, but you sure are a crazy son of a bitch!

[They all laugh]
You think I'm crazy? You call me crazy, you think I'm crazy? You wanna see crazy?
[Riggs starts slapping him self on the head, Stooges style, then pokes their eyes and slaps them, and pulls out his gun]
. Now that's a real badge, I'm a real cop, and this is a real fucking gun!

[menacing]
Okay, pal...
Hey, noses in the dirt, asshole...
[And the guns start blazin']
You know you're not the first guy to thinnk of this you know. A lot people have got problems especially during the silly season like now.
You know shit.
No, you're wrong, pal, you're wrong.
You don't know nothing. Don't touch me!
Take it easy.
Look, I didn't don any thing wrong.
I know that. It's not like your murdering anyone or anything.
That's right.
That's right.
The only one I hurt was me. Me!
Same way I feel. I know you're hurting. I get it. OK now, come on.
Don't come near me!

Come on. Give me a break, will ya guy. My boss is down there and he's watching us and I gotta make it look like I'm at least trying to save you. Come on. Im just gonna stand here and talk to you. That's all.
You won't try nothing.
No. I'm square with you. I won't try a thing. I won't try a thing.
Really.
What, do you think I want to fall off? I promise, I'll just talk to you.

[easing]
OK. Alright.

[showing him a cigarette]
Here, do you want a cigarette. Come on, lets smoke, OK.
Yeah.
Go on, take it yeah. If we take our time we will both die of cancer.
[lights his own cigarette]
Here.
[shows him the lighter but tricks him and cuffs the two of them together]
Hey, what are you doing.
See this key? Bye-bye.
You're crazy!
Now you can jump if you want to, but you'll be taking me with you and that makes you a muderer.
You want me to drive?
No, you're supposed to be suicidal, remember? I'LL drive.
Anybody who drives around in this town IS suicidal.
Have you ever met anybody you didn't kill?
Well, I haven't killed you yet.
You don't trust me at all, do you?
Well, I'll tell you what. You make it through tomorrow without killing anybody, especially me, or yourself, then I'll start trusting you.
Fair enough.
See how easy that was? Boom, still alive. Now we question him. You know why we question him? Because I got him in the leg. I didn't shoot him full of holes or try to jump off a building with him.
Hey, that's no fair. The building guy lived.
Pretty thin, huh?
Anorexic.
[Riggs is having doubts]
Why is there a problem?
There's no problem.
We got one dead girl and one dead guy. The dead guy kills the dead girl, we kill the dead guy 'cause he wanted us to be dead guys - it's pretty easy to me.
Hey, Riggs.
Yo!
Riggs, if you think I'm gonna eat the world's lousiest Christmas turkey by myself, you're crazy.
I'm not crazy.
I know.
Well, good. Let's eat.

50 years old, what a birthday, goddamn 50 years old, been on the force 20 years, not a scratch on me, not a scar, got a wife, kids, a house, a fishing boat, but I can kiss all that goodbye because my new partner has a death wish, my fucking life is over

[looks at Roger]
I was...
Just shut up you hear, why are you talking to me anyway, I'm a dead man, yeah fuck it, you're looking a dead man here
[oncoming traffic honks at them and swerve to get out of the way]

[points at oncoming traffic]
watch, watch, WATCH...
Don't worry, I was driving before you were itching in your daddy's pants

[discussing a theory]
That's pretty fucking thin.
That's very thin.
What the hell, thin's my middle name.
Your wife's cooking, I'm not surprised.
[fires his gun several more times]
What? What?
Nothin'.
Remarks like that will not get you invited to Christmas dinner.
My luck's changing for the better every day.
Maybe there's an opening in the L.A. Fire Department.
General, Mr. Mendez is here.

[turns around to greet Mendez]
Ah, Mr. Mendez. How are you?
Hey, I'm fine.
[motioning to Mr. Joshua]
Where the hell did you get him? Psychos 'R Us?
I don't think you're funny.
I don't think this whole goddamn setup's funny. You're using mercenaries, for chrissake, tell me I'm wrong.
No. You're not wrong.
And you expect me to trust these fuckin' bozos?
My people are loyal, Mr. Mendez. They are loyal to me.
Ohhh, bullshit...
Do you smoke?
What the hell does that got to do with anything, do I smoke...
Do you smoke?
Yeah.
Give me your lighter.
My... my lighter?
Your lighter!
Yeah, okay right here... here, take it...
[thugs grab his arm, General McAllister grabs Mendez's hand, still holding the lighter]
Hey, man, what the fuck is wrong with you guys? Aw, Jesus...
Shut your mouth! Shut up! And don't move.
[flicks the lighter on]
Mr. Joshua, your left arm, please...
[Mr. Joshua bares his arm, and allows the lighter to be held under his forearm, which starts to burn]
Hey, you guys are fuckin' gone... you know what I'm sayin'?... Aw, Jesus Christ!
[looks disgusted, as Joshua's arm continues to be burnt]
You guys are fuckin' crazy, man. Come on!

[clicking the lighter off]
Have Endo look at that, Mr. Joshua.
Yes, sir.
[gives Mendez a look, and walks off]

[to Mendez]
You wish to do business with us, yes? You wish to make a purchase, yes?
Yes, yes, Jesus Christ, yes... Ya know, you guys are out there like fuckin' Pluto, man. You're gone!
The bulk of the heroin will be here Friday night, we'll make delivery at that time. Have the money ready, and no tricks. If you try anything... you'll have to talk to Mr. Joshua. Merry Christmas.
Listen, sorry about all that shit I was in your face about earlier... you saved my life. Thank you.
Oh, I'll bet that hurt to say.

[chuckles]
You'll never know.
Hey, you know what?
What?
Well, I think your daughter kinda likes me.
If you touch her, I'll kill you.
Ha! You'll try.

[holding his wife's wedding photograph, crying, after deciding not to kill himself]
See you later, babe.
[Riggs and Murtaugh pull up outside Dixie's house to check out a theory]
Like I said, thin.
Probably nothing.
[the house explodes, knocking them both to the ground. Murtaugh throws himself on Riggs]
What are you, a fag?
Your coat's on fire!
[Riggs throws it off, then both of them look at the burning house]
Probably nothing!
Thin, very thin!
Roger.
What?
[last lines]
I'm too old for this...
What did he mean when he said you owed him?
We served together in '65. Ia Drang Valley. Saved my life. Took a bayonet in the lungs.
That was nice of him.

[cops drive up after the drug dealer shoot-out]
Whaddaya got, Riggs?
There's three down, and one loose in here, he's got black hair and a red shirt...
Okay, let's go! I'm coverin' the left side...
[Riggs weaves around through Christmas trees, and the 3rd dealer jumps him]
Freeze! Freeze! Gimme the gun!
[to Riggs, holding a gun to his head]
How's it feel, sucker?
Hey... shoot 'im!
Drop it, prick!
Hey, shoot him! Shoot him! Shoot him! Will somebody shoot this prick? Shoot 'im! Shoot 'im!
Shut the fuck up!

[drawing a bead on the dealer]
Freeze!
Shoot him! Shoot him! Somebody shoot this prick? Shoot 'im! Shoot 'im!

[to drug dealer]
Shoot me! Shoot me! Shoot me! Ohhh...
[in frustration, Riggs head-butts him, grabs the gun away from him, and holds it to the dealer's throat]

[stealing a woman's car]
Mind if I test drive your Audi?

[Riggs and Murtaugh go to a bust at a "rich house"]
Think I saw this house on Lifestyles of the Rich and Shameless...
Maybe we'll stay alive long enough for me to buy you a present.

[about Rianne's date]
The one with the pits in his face?
Those are dimples!
Those are pits. When he smiles, I can see through his head.
Do you really wanna jump? Do you wanna? Well then thats fine with me. Come on, lets do it asshole. Let's do it. I wanna do it. I wanna do it.

[to Joshua]
Looking for your general friend? He's barbecuing his nuts on Hollywood Blvd.
How about it, Jack? Would you like a shot at the title?
Don't mind if I do.
[Riggs is captured by General McAlister]
You're General Peter McAlister, Commander of Shadow Company.
I see we've heard of each other.
Yep. It'll almost be a shame when I nail you.
[When Joshua is panting on the lawn after the title-fight]
Get that shit off my lawn!
[aiming his gun at Mcalister's oncoming car]
No way you live. No way.

[punches Murtaugh in the mouth]
The shipment, Mr. Murtaugh.

[blood and sweat dripping]
Go spit.
Hey, Riggs, you really like my wife's cookin'?

[after an especially long pause]
Nope, I'll see you tomorrow.
Had a jumper here last night, Dixie was walking by, saw the whole thing.
You got a statement from her, send her home.
Oh, thanks, I'm beat. You know how it is...
Yeah, yeah, sure. All dressed up and no one to blow.
You're hilarious. God, I don't believe this...
[Joshua blasts his way into Murtaugh's house and finds it empty. In the living room, 1951's "Scrooge" is playing on the television]
Tell me, what day is it?
What day?

[shoots the television]
Goddamn Christmas!
Good afternoon Mr. Mendez.
Yeah, how you doing?
Did you pat him down Mr. Larch?
Aw hey man, we went through this act already...

[Cutting off Mendez]
Go through it again!
Who are you?
That's hardly important but if it matters you may call me Mr. Joshua.
[Turns and motions to follow him]
Let's go.
Oh, great, swell, Mr. Joshua, huh?
[Follows]
General McAlister. Time for you to die.
I was driving before you were a itch in your daddy's pants!
There's no more heroes left in the world.
